content: The museum has a lot of exhibits about modern Korea, from newspapers to various document photos, detailing the history and development process of South Korea. In fact, each country in modern times has developed very quickly, but to a different degree.

North Korea tour guide said that North Korea is one of the five ancient civilizations in the world. South Koreans say that Qu Yuan and Scorpion are South Korean. Sometimes they feel that although there are 38 lines divided, the two countries are really the same source.

The Korean History Museum, compared to the Korean History Museum, has a more modern sense of entry, which fully introduces the major events of the Republic of Korea from the early days of the founding of the Republic of Korea to the present, and the cultural relics of the resistance to the United States and the DPRK.

The Korean History Museum is very good! It systematically shows the historical changes of Korea, from ancient to modern. The exhibitions in the museum are rich and varied, including cultural relics, pictures, models, etc., so that people can understand the development of Korea in a visual way. There are also multimedia displays and interactive experiences, which add fun to the visit. Here, you can deeply feel the historical and cultural heritage of Korea.

Other museums in Seoul tell stories of South Korea from the Neolithic to the present, and the focus of this museum is the twentieth century, which takes place in several periods. During Japanese rule, there were many things, no unexpected dark tones. The rise of modern Korea is both interesting and inspiring.

The Korean History Museum does not need admission tickets and is free to visit. It is on the side of Guanghua Gate Square with symmetrical long central axis. It is not far from Jingfu Palace. It can be visited together. The Museum mainly displays some Korean culture. Four exhibition halls introduce the history of different times in Korea, mainly modern history. It is suggested that we visit the museum first and then go to Jingfu Palace for more detailed understanding.

The Historical Museum of the Republic of Korea focuses on major events in modern and contemporary Korean history, with a large number of precious historical relics. If you are in Seoul, you must go and see it. There are good English profiles and new chapters to honor the victims of Japanese imperialist comfort women.

On the way to Jingfu Palace, we saw the Republic of Korea History Museum. The introduction was in Korean and English. We could get free audio commentary, trying to tell tourists how fast Korea had developed after the war. The museum also had a cafe and a roof platform.
It's National Museun of Korean Contemporary History, on the side of the bronze statue of Shizong, outside Guanghua Gate Square. Free Admission. Rarely, a special Children "s Museum is built in.

This museum is wonderful and strategically located. Just next to the palace and the American embassy. No tickets, very beautiful South Korean history exhibition, telling the history of the Korean War from before the Japanese occupation to the present. Very well presented, very informative, with panel discussions in English and Korean. Well worth a visit for anyone interested in history - especially on Monday, something is open to the outside world but also on any day! They also have a children's museum we didn't visit, and a cafe with coffee and baked goods.

Korean Republic of Korea History Museum, which displays many Korean historical relics, here you can better understand the history and culture of Korea like friends can come to see tickets are not particularly expensive.
From the end of the nineteenth century to the present, the museum has rich historical materials in Korea, with animation and video introductions, which are of great ornamental value.

The National History Museum of Korea is very large. It exhibits Korean history, including the Korean War. The tickets are inexpensive. The exhibits have explanations in English, Chinese and Japan, but only in English.

The Republic of Korea History Museum, the works displayed here are introduced to you in the form of video animation. Visiting here is free without tickets. Friends who like the history of the Republic of Korea must not miss it.

South Korea History Museum, in the south of Jingfu Palace, next to Guanghua Gate, exhibits Korean history, including the Korean War. The museum tickets are not expensive. After reading this, you can go to Jingfu Palace.
Coming to the Republic of Korea History Museum, we can learn about the history of Korea from political, economic, cultural, social and other aspects, which is worth visiting.

The Republic of Korea History Museum is a state-level theme exhibition hall, where many ancient Korean works of art are collected, including some bronzes, as well as cultural exhibitions of other countries.
Like China, Korea was also one of the victims of Japanese aggression during World War II. Faced with this naked record, I don't know why the Japanese just refuse to admit this irrefutable history.

The permanent exhibition hall on the 3.5 floor can be divided into four different periods according to the chronological order. The successive visits can reveal the changes of Korean modern history. All exhibits are accompanied by Korean and English bilingual descriptions. At the entrance of the exhibition hall in different periods, a summary of the exhibition hall marked with Korean, Chinese, English and Japanese languages is set up. Photographs are allowed in the exhibition hall, but flash lights and tripods are prohibited.

Much of the content of the History Museum is about Japan's aggression against Korea, and the efforts of the Korean people to resist, feeling that Korea has very similar feelings towards Japan and us. There is little mention of the fact that it was once a subsidiary state of China, perhaps implying the implicit unwillingness of the Koreans. At that time, how many Korean scholars hoped to have some connection with Daming and Qing Dynasty, even the tombstone said Daming.

The National Korean Museum is a place to display, experience and learn about the history and value of Korean. The total building area of the museum is 11,322 ㎡, divided into 1 underground floor and 3 above ground floor, with outdoor lawn plaza and lounge for displaying educational activities. The first floor of the museum is the Korean World (library), the second floor is the permanent exhibition hall and the beautiful world (Korean cultural goods shops and tea shops), and the third floor is composed of facilities such as the planning exhibition hall, children's Korean playground, and the foreigner Korean learning field.
